Articles.Content:
Hello all,

I run with a pretty heavily modded game. I have been trying to find better engines for the purposes of clustering. Specifically, I am looking engines that are realistic in that they have no predefined coupling ring at the bottom of the tank, and just have the structure and turbopumps to attach to the tanks. I already have FASA, KW, and Near Future propulsion. It is ok if these are older packs, I can adjust configs for .24 of my own. I have seen the soviet engine pack, but I am concerned about he RAM footprint. As an extension of this, is there a mod which strips the tank connectors from stock engines (if appropriate)? I could do this myself, but I guess .mu files can not be reverse engineered?

TL;DR, looking for realistic form factor engines, I can upgrade them per part for .24 if necessary, and I already have FASA.

Thanks!
You should check out AIES, it has some small surface mount engines that might be just what you're looking for.
Thank you very much. Also just remembered Nova Punch. Is there no AEIS 0.24 version? It's fine if there isn't, I just want to make sure of this before I start reconfiguring them.
